metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27671 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.14.x allowing x86 HVM and PVH guest OS users to cause a denial of service (data corruption), cause a data leak, or possibly gain privileges because coalescing of per-page IOMMU TLB flushes is mishandled.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxenevtchn1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxengnttab1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxenhypfs1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxenmisc4.16 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxenstore4 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxentoolcore1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
libxentoollog1 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
xen-hypervisor-4.16-amd64 - 4.11.4+57-g41a822c392-1
